Problem:
Evaluate the effects of a Fourier transform on a causal system described by the differential equation \\( \\frac{dx}{dt} = -Ax + u(t) \\), where A is a constant scalar and u(t) is an external input. Assume \\( U(s) \\) is the Laplace transform of u(t) and consider the impact of transforming the initial conditions via a convolution with another function \\( h(t) \\).

If the system dynamics are modified at time \\( t_1 \\) by changing A to a new constant \\( B \\), and the input function u(t) is also changed at that time, will the Fourier-transformed state of the system at a later time t depend exclusively on the new dynamics and new input?
Explanation: The Fourier-transformed state depends on the entire history of the system including the effects of the original dynamics characterized by A prior to \\( t_1 \\), as well as the impacts of the intervention with new dynamics B and the changed input function. This history impacts the frequency components and their phases.
